publicationstmt.publisher: State University of New York at Oswego

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created with EADitor by Zachary Vickery.
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: Personal records of SUNY Oswego athletic coach and professor Jo Ann Meadows.

repository.corpname: State University of New York at Oswego

bioghist.p: Jo Ann Meadows was born in 1940 and grew up in Middletown, Ohio. She received a BS in Health & Physical Education from Bowling Green, Ohio, and a Master's degree in Physical Education from Smith College. She holds a National Honorary Basketball Officials Rating. She taught at Douglas College, New Brunswick, NJ from 1965-70. She joined the SUNY Oswego faculty in 1970 and retired in 2000. From 1970-86 she was the women's baskeball coach; from 1973-91 she was the women's athletic director; from 1991-93 she was an assistant athletic director. She was also an Associate Professor of Health and Physical Education. From 1991-92 she was the President of the SUNY Athletic Conference.
In 1991, she and another women's athletic coach filed a Title XI suit against the college. It was dismissed in 1994 after a jury trial.

controlaccess.subject: Women's rights
Women college students

Sports

scopecontent.p: Includes memos, correspondence, staff reviews, team and individual women's sports statistics, suit filed under Title XI, Women's Varsity Sports Organization, women's athletics budgets & sports schedules, women's basketball scorebooks & yearbooks, athletics department administrative records.

userestrict.p: Please contact SUNY Oswego Archives and Special Collections for use restrictions.

scopecontent.p: Lists number and percentages of undergraduates for each year, by males and females.
